frameDefinitions: The Lender gives the Theme to the Borrower with the expectation that the Borrower will return the Theme to the Lender after a Duration of time.
A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
An Offerer indicates that he or she is able and willing to give a Theme to a Potential_recipient.
In this frame, a Resource_controller is judged by a Judge (who is usually implicit)  according to how freely they allow the Recipient access to their Resource.
The Borrower takes possession of a Theme with the knowledge that the Borrower will have to give the Theme back to the Lender after a Duration of time.
frameExamples: I am <t>lending</t> a student of mine my book on German modal particles.
The host graciously <t>offered</t> us food and drink.
I am <t>borrowing</t> the book about modal particles from the professor.
listRoleDefinitions: The person or institution who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The object that is transferred from the <fen>Lender</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The time when the lending event occurs.
The location in which the Lender lends the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen>.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and offers it to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object which is offered for transfer.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
The Resource_Controller is the individual who controls access to the Resource.
The Resource_controller controls the Recipient's access to the Resource.
The <fen>Recipient</fen> is the individual or individuals who receive or should receive the <fen>Resource</fen> from the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The Behavior is an action of the Resource_controller which is judged to be generous or stingy.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The person who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The object that the <fen>Borrower</fen> receives from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
When the borrowing even occurs.
The location in which the <fen>Borrower</fen> gets the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen>.
listRoleExamples: I lent the book <fex>to him</fex> for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
<fex>I</fex> lent the book to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
I lent <fex>the book</fex> to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
I lent him my car <fex>on Friday</fex>.
I lent him my book <fex>in Dubai</fex>.
Surprising, Dad was stingy <fex>with his inheritance</fex>.
Mr. Burns is extremely miserly <fex>towards his employees</fex>.
It was generous of Jim <fex>to have us over for dinner</fex>.
<fex>Tracy</fex> borrowed that book from Leonard last week.
Tracy borrowed that book <fex>from Leonard</fex> last week.
I am borrowing his car <fex>at the airport</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Fed Opens Discount Window to Broker Dealers

sourceCandidateSpans.text: a matter of a month or two
the Peterson Institute for International Economics
